Key Match Events: Brandon Pfaadt struggled badly after the first inning, giving up eight runs, only six earned, eight hits, a walk, and six strikeouts.
Jordan Montgomery made his debut out of the bullpen to a bases-loaded nightmare, hitting the first batter he faced to drive in a run.
Lourdes Gurriel Jr. hit a solo homer and Corbin Carroll hit a two-run home run in the 7th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Torey Lovullo said 'The D-backs beat the D-backs in a couple of situations today.'
Brandon Pfaadt said 'I didn't feel great today command wise, velo was down a bit.'
Lovullo shared that 'He did his job the way we wanted him to do his job. I'm very proud of him for making the adjustment and figuring it out.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Arizona Diamondbacks take on the New York Mets for game two of the series Wednesday night at 6:40 PM. Eduardo Rodriguez starts for Arizona while Luis Severino starts for New York.
Others: Jordan Montgomery proceeded to pitch the next four innings and gave up no runs with just five hits and one walk allowed.
Lovullo talked about Montgomery's performance, 'He did his job the way we wanted him to do his job. I'm very proud of him for making the adjustment and figuring it out.'
